items.title: Commute up to 40 miles on Buzz Bicycle’s Cerana 2 e-bike at a new budget-friendly $800 low (Reg. $1,499)
items.summary:
Buzz Bicycles currently has a strong budget-friendly deal on its Cerana 2 Commuter e-bike at $799.99 shipped, which we aren’t sure yet if this is the new starting price or just a discount. It’s been going for $1,499 up until recently, with most discounts over the last year having been to $1,300, like we’re currently seeing from Walmart, though 2025 did see it go lower than ever to $999 in the last few months. Today’s deal is better than we’ve ever seen, with this being a $699 markdown that either sets a new all-time low or officially fixes the price at this low. Either way, jumping on this deal now gives you quite the budget-friendly means to commute outside of gas cars and the like through 2026 and beyond.

This model has mostly kept to or near its full price over the last year, with discounts having dropped costs to $3,800, $3,700, and $3,608 for a short period during July’s Prime Day event. Today’s deal repeats the more average savings we’ve seen over 2025, giving you $500 off the going rate for the third-best price since summer 2024. You can find other deals on Greenworks push mowers in its Amazon storefront here, while the direct website has a much more extensive list of options for various riding mowers – legacy and new – while also offering varying battery packages, too.

Both of these models are no longer available direct from the brand’s website, but you can find the lesser H800-VF robot at $1,299 shipped there, making these two Amazon deals all the better, as you get more yard coverage with them. They’d normally go for $1,599 and $1,999 at full price these days, though we’ve been seeing them hold at $1,299 and $1,599 since December, with things going even lower today. While we have seen the price in past years drop further, you’re still looking at solid $600 and $700 markdowns that are worth considering while you upgrade to smarter and more autonomous mowing.
